Vietnam: Hàm Nghi captured and exiled to Algeria.
Emperor Đồng Khánh (1885–1889) ended his rule of Vietnam.
USA: Looking Backward, by Edward Bellamy, is published.
The National Geographic Society is founded.
Tanzania: The German East Africa Company leases the coastal strip opposite Zanzibar from Sultan Khalifah bin Said for 50 years.
Taiwan: Construction on a Taibei-Xinzhu road begins
Singapore: Henry Ridley becomes the director of the Singapore Botanic Gardens.
The Singapore Fire Brigade was formed.
Indonesia: Founding of the shipping line Koninklijke Paketvaart-Maatschappij (KPM) that supported the unification and development of the colonial economy.
Haiti: President Salomon is overthrown; the Constituent Assembly installs a provisional government
The Constituent Assembly elects François Denys Légitime to the presidency
France: First Stage of the Eiffel Tower is completed.
Second Stage of the Eiffel Tower is completed.
Colombia: Carlos Holguín Mallarino is the 4th President of Colombia
Chile: Policarpo Toro leads a naval expedition to annex Easter Island. The Catholic University of Chile is privately founded.
Brazil: The Lei Áurea abolishes the last remnants of slavery.
Australia: Louisa Lawson established The Dawn: A Journal for Australian Women.
